                        As told by breathless and often wrong headlines.

            By 
Nick Gass

10/21/15 01:15 PM EDT

                    Updated 10/21/15 01:42 PM EDT
For much of the past year, Vice President Joe Biden has had the political media on tenterhooks in the seemingly endless will-he-or-won't-he melodrama of whether he would jump into the Democratic primary race.
With Biden officially out of the running, here's a look back at how the media covered Biden's decision-making and discussions within the vice president's orbit, as told by the headlines:
Story Continued Below
Feb. 12, ABC News: "Joe Biden Reveals Timeframe for 2016 Presidential Decision"
June 17, U.S. News: "Biden Not Bowing Out, Will Decide on White House Run by August"
June 26, USA Today: "Family a top concern as Biden weighs presidential bid"
June 28, The Wall Street Journal: "Will He Run? Biden Speculation Mounts"
Aug. 1, New York Times op-ed: "Joe Biden in 2016: What Would Beau Do?"
Aug. 1, The New York Times: "Joe Biden Said to Be Taking New Look at Presidential Run"
Aug. 9, The Associated Press: "Biden expected to decide about race after weeklong retreat"
Aug. 16, CNN: "Advisers tell Biden: Decide by October 1"
Aug. 21, POLITICO: "Biden games out presidential run with circle of advisers"
Aug. 23, The Wall Street Journal: "Joe Biden Is Leaning Toward a 2016 Run"
Aug. 24, POLITICO: "The Biden Dither"
Aug. 25, CNN: "Obama gives Joe Biden 'blessing' for 2016 bid"
Aug. 26, CNN: "Biden unsure if he has the 'emotional fuel' for 2016 run"
Oct. 3, CBS News: "Joe Biden could decide presidential run in the next week"
Oct. 15, POLITICO: "Biden sidesteps the question"
Oct. 16, CNN: "Joe Biden camp to allies: Be ready"
Oct. 19, NBC News: "Biden Nears Decision Time"
Oct. 19, The Washington Post: "We are now on our 12th timeline for a Biden announcement"
Oct. 20, CBS News: "Joe Biden inches closer to critical 2016 deadlines"
Oct. 21, POLITICO: "Biden bows out"
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: As told by breathless and often wrong headlines.
title: The 250 days of pointless Biden speculation
